metadata.title: CVE-2016-0830 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
btif_config.c in Bluetooth in Android 6.x before 2016-03-01 allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption and persistentdaemon crash) by triggering a large number of configuration entries, andconsequently exceeding the maximum size of a configuration file, akainternal bug 26071376.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0830` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

android - 20160307-0742-0ubuntu3
android-copyright - 20160307-0742-0ubuntu3
android-emulator - 20160307-0742-0ubuntu3
ubuntu-emulator-images - 20160307-0742-0ubuntu3
ubuntu-emulator-runtime - 20160307-0742-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: android package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '20160307-0742-0ubuntu3').
